caption.p: Lasso feature selection diagram. The x-coordinate is the logarithm function of the penalty coefficient λ, and the y-coordinate is the mean square error. (A) As lambda changes, the coefficient of the variable is compressed to zero. (B) The dotted line on the left represents the value of the λ log function with the minimum mean squared error, and the right represents the best lambda log function. The value at the top of the image is the number of features.
